title: Data Scientist, CCM
description:
Primary Responsibilities
The aim of the Center for Computational Mathematics (CCM) is to become a leading international center for the study of applied mathematics, machine learning, signal processing and related fields. Tremendous opportunities exist at the intersection of mathematics, computer science, statistics, and their scientific applications, with the lines between theory, algorithm development and software implementation often blurred. A major goal of CCM is to develop the next generation of simulation and analysis methods and to make them available to the scientific community. The center will also host an array of meetings, workshops and conferences, serving as a focal point for the field internationally.
As such, CCM is currently seeking a full-time Data Scientist or Software Engineer (based on experience), reporting to a Research Scientist. The successful applicant will primarily assist in the development and maintenance of CaImAn, the popular open source software package developed in the Flatiron Institute for the analysis of fluorescence microscopy (calcium imaging) neuroscience data. Duties will include optimizing the existing codebase, developing new or incorporating existing algorithms in the codebase, and supporting a large and diverse userbase. Participation in other projects within the CCM is also possible.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Education
B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related technical discipline.
Ideal Experience
Several years of professional experience with back-end software development
Experience with analysis of functional fluorescence microscopy data (calcium imaging)
Proficiency in Python
Background in linear algebra, high dimensional statistics and machine learning
Experience with developing and using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch
Experience in processing high volume data on computing clusters and cloud environments
Familiarity with Linux
Related Skills & Other Requirements
Knowledge of software engineering practices for working in groups, including software development life cycles, coding standards, code review and version control systems (Git).
Expertise in algorithms and data structures
Experience with C++, QT and GPU programming
Background in image processing & computer vision
Technical and scientific curiosity
Professional communication skills and a demonstrated commitment to customer service
Application Materials
A current CV with complete list of publications and links to software repositories
Two (2) names and emails of people who can be consulted for confidential references
